net.dean.jraw.http

Class HttpLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.http.HttpLogger

  • public class HttpLogger
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for logging objects relating to HTTP network activity, particularly the HttpRequest and RestResponse classes. The parts of the request and response are broken into parts called components. By default, all of these components are enabled (except for HttpLogger.Component.RESPONSE_BODY_ALWAYS_FULL. To enable or disable a Component, you can use enable(Component) or disable(Component) respectively.

      Represents the components involved in logging an HTTP request and response

      • log

        public void log(HttpRequest r)
        Logs an HTTP request in this format: 
        
 $method $url
     form-data: {$key1=$val2,
                 $key2=$val2}
     headers: {$key1=$val1}
        Where $requestDescriptor is the combination of the HTTP method and URL (ex: "POST http://www.example.com").
        Parameters:
        r - The request to log

      • log

        public void log(RestResponse r)
        Logs an HTTP response in this format: 
        
 $protocol $code $message
     headers: {$key1=$val1,
               $key2=$val2}
        Parameters:
        r - The response to log
